snippet: The media conglomerate attributed the decision to underperforming programming and job cuts made during a recent restructuring.
abstract: Viacom reports it will take pretax charge of around $785 million for quarter that ended in March, part of broader reorganization at the company; company says it expects around $175 million in savings in 2015.
lead_paragraph: The media conglomerate attributed the decision to underperforming programming and job cuts made during a recent restructuring.

headline.main: Viacom to Take 2nd-Quarter Write-Downs of $785 Million
headline.print_headline: Viacom Sets $785 Million Write-Down for Quarter
